com.esri.mo2.src.sys
Interface Source

All Known Implementing Classes:
ArcIms4Source, BaseSource, FileSystemSource, SdeSource
public interface Source

a Source represents an external source of data, such as a database or file system. A Source produces the root Folders from which Content can be obtained. Sources are cached, so that Datasets produced from this Source are unique.

Here is a typical sequence of events for connecting with a Source:

   Connection connection = new ConnectionImplementation(connection-specific parameters...);
   Source source = SourceCache.getSource(connection);
   if (false == source.isConnected())
       source.connect();
   ....
   source.disconnect();

See Also:
SourceCache, Connection

Field Detail

ResourceBundleName

public static final String ResourceBundleName
name of the ResourceBundle used for accessing properties related to Sources.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

getContent

public Content getContent(String path)
                   throws IOException
find and return a Content for the given path.

Returns:
the Content object corresponding to the given path, or null == path not found or not connected.
IOException

getRoots

public Content[] getRoots()
                   throws IOException
Returns:
one or more Content objects corresponding to the top-level Contents of this Connection, or null == path not found or not connected
IOException

connect

public void connect()
             throws IOException
by invoking this method you cause the Source to obtain information necessary for getRoots() and getContent(). For some types of Source, this will open a statefull session with a server, for example ArcSDE. To release the statefull session, you must subsequently invoke disconnect().

IOException

refresh

public void refresh()
             throws IOException
by invoking this method you cause the Source to refresh information necessary about getRoots() and getContent() without creating a new underlying connection.

IOException

disconnect

public void disconnect()
                throws IOException
by invoking this method you cause the connection to release all underlying resources. You can subsequently re-connect by invoking connect().

IOException

isConnected

public boolean isConnected()
Returns:
true if this Source is currently connected, false if currently disconnected.
